title: Configure authorization for Content Store
content:
By default, the tenant admin user that's assigned to the tenant in Suite Administration has the privilege to access the application or data and menu items for Content Store. If you want additional users to access the Content Store application or data and menu items, follow the below sections to configure authorization and configure menu visibility.

Configure permissions for additional users

To configure authorization for users to access the Content Store application, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin.
  2. Go to Administration > People and select the user you want to give access to.
  3. On the Person page, under Group membership, select Assign to group.
  4. In the Add groups popup, select the group that you want this user to be a part of, for example, Content Store Tenant Administrators and DND Administrators.
  5. Select Save.
    Now the user has the privilege to access the Content Store application. Next, the tenant admin needs to assign the rights for the user to access the menu items for Content Store.

Content Store groups

Group Role  Description
CS_ADMINISTRATORS CS_ADMINISTRATOR Users in this group are administrators who can do tenant level configurations and configure DND and OO access points.
CS_ADMINISTRATORS CS_CONTENT_MANAGER Users in this group can perform all Content Store related operations, for example, installing content and uninstalling content.
CS_INTEGRATION_ACCOUNTS CS_INTEGRATION Users in this group have the Content Store integration accounts role. 

Content Store permissions

CS_CONTENT_DETAIL: User needs this permission to get the content details through Content Store.

CS_CONTENT_INSTALL: User needs this permission to install content through Content Store.

CS_CONTENT_UNINSTALL: User needs this permission to uninstall content through Content Store.

CS_REST: User needs this permission to access Content Store APIs.

CS_TENANT_ADMIN: User with this permission will have tenant administrative rights to the Content Store account.

Content Store roles

Following table provides all the Content Store roles and the associated permissions:

Role Permissions
CS_ADMINISTRATOR CS_TENANT_ADMIN, CS_REST
CS_CONTENT_MANAGER CS_REST, CS_CONTENT_INSTALL, CS_CONTENT_UNINSTALL, CS_CONTENT_DETAIL

Add or revoke Content Store permissions

To add or remove Content Store permissions for a role, follow these steps. All Content Store permissions start with "CS":

  1. Log in to the IdM Admin Portal (https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin).
  2. From the left hand side navigation panel, select Roles. You can see the Role list.
  3. From the list, select the Content Store role that you want to edit, for example, Content Store Tenant Administrator, and then select the Edit icon. Then you can see the Role Edit page.
  4. Under Associated Permissions, you can add or remove permissions.

Configure user role for menu visibility in Service Management

An out-of-the-box role, CMP Agent, is available with permissions to modules that are applicable to the Cloud Management mode. You can assign this new role to the desired agent users or add this role to the desired group.

Before you configure the menu visibility for Content Store, make sure that:

  • The suite admin has deployed DND in Suite Administration and you as the tenant admin have enabled the feature in Service Management (Administration > Application Settings > Enable Service Design and Deployment).
  • The Cloud Management experience mode is selected in Administration > Application Setting.

You can assign the CMP Agent role by following these steps:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as a tenant admin and navigate to Administration > People > All people.
  2. Select a user to assign the role. This takes you to the Person page.
  3. Under System use definitions, search and select CMP Agent Role from the drop-down menu.
  4. Select Save.
  5. Log in to the Agent Interface as the DND admin user. The user now has rights to access the Content Management menu items.
